alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 11:48AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marshall and northern Woodford Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bradford to near Dunlap. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Henry around 1155 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Washburn and Minonk. This includes Interstate 39 between mile markers 27 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
